definition: to walk right into the trap
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
gauze/to collect/to gather/to catch/to sift
surname Luo
net/network

sentences.english: We set an Ambush on all sides, waiting for the enemy to come into the trap.
sentences.chinese: 我们设下十面埋伏，专等敌人自投罗网。
没有罪犯愿意自投罗网。

sentences.english: If she is the bait in the trap, I'm willing to spring it.
sentences.chinese: 即使她是圈套里的诱饵，我也甘愿自投罗网。

definition: to catch a turtle in a jar (idiom); to set oneself an easy target/a turkey shoot
lit. like a turtle in a jar/to be trapped (idiom)
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
lit. even given wings, you couldn't fly (idiom); fig. impossible to escape
lit. to guard a tree-stump, waiting for rabbits (idiom)/to wait idly for opportunities/to trust to chance rather than show initiative
lit. a lamb in a tiger's den (idiom)/fig. to tread dangerous ground
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to fall into a trap/taken in by a stratagem/cheated/ripped off
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
to throw away one's life
to show the wolf into the house (idiom)/to introduce a potential source of trouble
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
hands tied and waiting to be captured
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
